javadoc:
Adds a border to a component that displays a title and provides a area for adding
 components (usually icon buttons)

methods.name: <init>

params.name: margin
params.comment: the size of the margin to use

methods.name: <init>

params.name: titleLabel
params.comment:
the title label for the panel; this allow clients to provide HTML-based
        title text.  Note: it is up to the client to escape this text as needed for safety

params.name: margin
params.comment: the size of the margin to use

methods.javadoc:
Adds a component to the right side of the title bar.
@param comp the component to add.
methods.name: addTitleComponent
methods.comment: Adds a component to the right side of the title bar.

methods.javadoc:
Sets a component below the main panel that was passed to the constructor.
 If the component passed to this method is null then the TitledPanel will
 not have a component below the main panel.
@param comp the component to display below the main panel. Null indicates none.
methods.name: setBottomComponent
methods.comment:
Sets a component below the main panel that was passed to the constructor.
 If the component passed to this method is null then the TitledPanel will
 not have a component below the main panel.

params.name: comp
params.comment: the component to display below the main panel. Null indicates none.

name: TitledPanel
comment:
Adds a border to a component that displays a title and provides a area for adding
 components (usually icon buttons)
